tool.name: qiime2 cutadapt demux-paired
tool.description: Demultiplex paired-end sequence data with barcodes in-sequence.

param.name: seqs
param.label: seqs: MultiplexedPairedEndBarcodeInSequence
param.help: [required] The paired-end sequences to be demultiplexed.

param.name: type
param.label: forward_barcodes: MetadataColumn[Categorical]
param.help: [required] The sample metadata column listing the per-sample barcodes for the forward reads.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

param.name: type
param.label: reverse_barcodes: MetadataColumn[Categorical]
param.help: [optional] The sample metadata column listing the per-sample barcodes for the reverse reads.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

param.name: error_rate
param.label: error_rate: Float % Range(0, 1, inclusive_end=True)
param.help: [default: 0.1] The level of error tolerance, specified as the maximum allowable error rate.

param.name: batch_size
param.label: batch_size: Int % Range(0, None)
param.help: [default: 0] The number of samples cutadapt demultiplexes concurrently. Demultiplexing in smaller batches will yield the same result with marginal speed loss, and may solve "too many files" errors related to sample quantity. Set to "0" to process all samples at once.

param.name: minimum_length
param.label: minimum_length: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [default: 1] Discard reads shorter than specified value. Note, the cutadapt default of 0 has been overridden, because that value produces empty sequence records.

param.name: mixed_orientation
param.label: mixed_orientation: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Handle demultiplexing of mixed orientation reads (i.e. when forward and reverse reads coexist in the same file).

tool.help:
QIIME 2: cutadapt demux-paired ============================== Demultiplex paired-end sequence data with barcodes in-sequence.
Outputs: -------- :per_sample_sequences.qza: The resulting demultiplexed sequences. :untrimmed_sequences.qza: The sequences that were unmatched to barcodes.
|
Description: ------------ Demultiplex sequence data (i.e., map barcode reads to sample ids). Barcodes are expected to be located within the sequence data (versus the header, or a separate barcode file).
|
